content: in any number of rounds preferably 4 rounds or fewer worked with the same colour do not be afraid of ends they are managed with the steek any of your choices will be called colour b legs or cloelgosu rs cet ufepet setup round 1 attach yarn b at the left point of bridge 1 fig 2 which is not established yet knit 64 72 80 stitches this is your sock 2 cast on 7 stitches for bridge 2 knit again 64 72 80 stitches for your sock 1 cast on 7 stitches for bridge 1 connect the yarn to the bseetguinp nrionugn odf 2 s ock 2 knit 64 72 80 stitches k3 p1 k3 across the 7 new stitches cast on in the previous round for bridge 2 knit again 64 72 80 stitches k3 p1 place bor marker k3 across bridge 1 let us describe the structure of two siamese socks again sock 2 is knit across the first 64 72 80 stitches and ends at bridge 2 bridge 2 prepares the steek that will divide the front legs and the insteps of both socks the single purl in the middle marks the column which is cut for a steek just in the middle of each purled stitch sock 1 is knit across the second 64 72 80 stitches that follow bridge 2 and ends at bridge 1 bridge 1 prepares the steek that will divide the back legs and the soles of both socks again the slteegesk position is marked by the purl stitch knit three more rounds in colour b the chart for the leg has 47 rounds to the start of the heel if you want a longer leg here is the place to add rounds continue with chart a for your size the chart a is worked twice once for sock 2 and once for sock 1 in this sequence between the legs 7 stitches of the bridges 1 and 2 are worke d in the following way k1 in b k1 in a k1 b p1 a k1 b k1 a k1 b charta starts at the inner side of the leg of sock 2 continues to the back of sock 2 and around to the front of sock 2 after bridge 2 chart a starts again at the inner side of sock 1 but continues to the front of sock 1 and then to the back of sock 1 finishing at bridge 1 the chart also continues from sock 2 to sock 1 and forms a wider view on city with skyscrapers if you like compare the structure presented in fig 2 and the cut and folded model given after the charts for better visualization the the motif has a few long floats at the beginning but floats are present also later because skyscrapers windows are in every second round to ensure elasticity i strongly suggest lbj technique with additional stitches at every fifth stitch beginning with the third stitch after
